channel.title: Releasing the client? (question)
channel.description:
My server is done coded and I need some help with what I should do before I release it.
is there anything special I have to do to the client folder before i give it out?

item.title: Releasing the client? (question)
item.dc:creator: @jelleplomp jelleplomp
item.description:
@jelleplomp wrote:

why dont you make a .jar file ?

item.title: Releasing the client? (question)
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

@echo off
del *.java

This deletes all you java files.

Read full topic

item.title: Releasing the client? (question)
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“petterrs96, post:5, topic:475466”]i the cilent to my friend and he was not able to run the client because he did not have jdk at all. but he is still able to play on other servers :s why? what should i do?

if anyone know what i can do. please add me on skype: petter.rs[/quote]

Open up your run.bat and find a line that may look something like/or start with this:

It’ll vary for each run.bat, basically, don’t delete the whole line but replace what’s with-in the quotes (including the quotes) with: java (no quotes)

If this doesn’t work for you, let me know, I tried to explain my best. If it doesn’t work post your run.bat in code tags and I’ll help futher.

Read full topic

item.title: Releasing the client? (question)
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

The Web Guy:

There’s more than just changing the IP, that’s a start though. And allstarrevolutionz, you can’t assume it’s a no-ip.org address, it doesn’t need to be a no-ip.org address to run the server. You will need to delete all of the .java files, so people can’t easily edit your client (though they still can by using a Java De-compiler.) Compress it to a .zip or .rar file using Win-rar, 7zip, etc. Then upload to a file sharing site (I recommend Uppit)

Along with deleting the Java files, (Make a new folder for release btw), you should hide all the files that aren’t important. I’d suggest hidding all the files except for the run.bat.

Read full topic

item.title: Releasing the client? (question)
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

There’s more than just changing the IP, that’s a start though. And allstarrevolutionz, you can’t assume it’s a no-ip.org address, it doesn’t need to be a no-ip.org address to run the server. You will need to delete all of the .java files, so people can’t easily edit your client (though they still can by using a Java De-compiler.) Compress it to a .zip or .rar file using Win-rar, 7zip, etc. Then upload to a file sharing site (I recommend Uppit)

Read full topic

item.title: Releasing the client? (question)
item.dc:creator: @allstarrevolutionz allstarrevolutionz
item.description:
@allstarrevolutionz wrote:

You need to go into client.java and search for 127.0.0.1 and change that to your ip address or your no-ip.org then compile and .rar it and upload it to a downloading site

Read full topic
